title: Oldest Haveli outside Jaislamer Fort
review: Guide claims this to be oldest Haveli constructed outside Jaisalmer Fort. It is not maintained properly. Outside view of this monument is better than inside visit.

title: Enjoyed and learned
review: Guided by Gaju.

title: Waste of Money and Time
review: Visited this haveli on 04 feb and trust me only exterior are nice and remaining part is waste of money.

title: Beautiful exteriors
review: Within walking distance from the fort, this haveli has an exquisite structure. However, the insides are not too well maintained, so not worth to go inside. The more maintained Patwon ki Haveli is a better bet to take a full tour. Overall Salim Singh ki haveli is beautiful to look at from the outside, but the tour can be given a miss.

title: Nothing to see
review: There is nothing special other than relation to the Kuldhara village. It's better to have a look from outside.

title: Interesting but run-down
review: I think that run-down is the most frequent word that I use in case of places of interests in south east asia. This Haveli is quite interesting already from the outside.One would expect that inside it looks at least as unique as form outside. Unfortunately, like in case of many monuments in that region inside part is very run-down. There was even a part of the roof that collapsed so one

title: marvelous piece of art
review: I am amazed by breathtaking amount of handwork and detailing thats gone into every nook and corner of the Haveli.

title: One of the havelli
review: Nothing much to see from inside , its one of the havelli's at jaiselmer , its only good to see from outside otherwise run down and not preserved

title: Very interesring tour! Highly recommended!
review: We came here with no exceptions and got such a great tour by Gajju! It was so interesting! All you have to bring is some time and you will be soon impressed by this beautiful haveli and its history! Its suggested to come without guide or tuktukdriver so you are not being pushed and have enough time.

title: Beautiful old haveli
review: If you like art and details one can visit this beautiful old haveli. Not always a part of a standard tour package, one should check before booking

title: Salim Singh ki Haveli
review: Salim Singh ki Haveli is a beautiful Haveli located near the fort, but the drive to it is through a narrow lane. The external view of the Haveli reveals some ornate designed balconies with two sand stone statues beautifully carved at the entrance. The interiors of the haveli are not maintained very well and there aren't any information boards to guide the tourists.

title: Hidden treasure
review: We didn't know what we were going to see, but we weren't disappointed! We got a great tour, explanation of everything and little history class from the owner which was great. To those who say it's in bad shape, it's not the fault of the owner, the rains attacks the rock and it's expensive too entertain such a complex building, we totally think it was worth it and not expensive

title: Nice
review: Again the haveli have their own importance. We got to know from lots of people and visited here. Nice work done in Haveli.

title: Old style Haveli
review: It’s an old Haveli (bungalow) and has the typical sandstone carving work on outside. Nice heritage building but nothing extra special. There are many such havelis in Jaisalmer.

title: Good walk with Guide
review: If you have to start the Haveli tour in Jaisalmer which practically has nothing else.. then start with this Havelli.

title: Salim Singh-ki Haveli
review: Salim Singh-ki Haveli is one of the oldest haveli in Jaisalmer. such an excellent example of stone work. worth to visit this place.

title: Nice stone work
review: The place is excellent example of the sand stone work. walkable distance from jaisalmer fort though narrow lanes of the city.

title: Rude Ticket Seller
review: We weren't allowed to visit the Haveli, as the guide was not available even during their operating hours. Further, when we requested if we could see the place without a guide, as we were leaving Jaisalmer the next day morning, the ticket seller, instead of politely declining our request, was unnecessarily rude and uncultured.

title: Masterpiece
review: Another masterpiece in Jaisalmer. This is a very beautiful haveli which was originally built in 17th century by Salim SIngh, who was Prime Minister of Jaisalmer. The architecture is distinct. The roof is in the form of Peacock. The haveli is near the Fort.

title: Beautiful
review: Just as beautiful as the patvon ki Haveli and also a must visit when in Jaislamer. Carvings are extraordinary.

title: very good informations about architecture and history
review: the Haveli is told to be the oldest one in Jaisalmer - and so is the condition of the house. If you expect a wonderful and well maintained place don’t go there.

title: Worst place
review: The visit to this haveli is a waste of time money and energy. Do not waste your time and they charge entry fee.

title: Waste of time
review: Absolutely nothing special. Very small portion of the haveli is open for public. Nothing great about the place.

title: Absolutely NOTHING to see inside!!! And not even a clear Fort View from roof...
review: Save yourself the time and money - there is absolutely NOTHING to see inside!!! Seriously, I mean nothing - only 3-4 empty decaying rooms, and a stairway that leads to the roof where you can't even get a clear view of the fort and get a good photo. You'll be out in less than 5 minutes, feels like a scam.

title: Beautiful Naksha
review: A very beautiful handwork which explains the special test of the people of that era. the artisan was a brilliant person

title: Not worth the visit.
review: Property was built to be one of most exquisite houses in Jaisalmer. But has lost all its charm. Not at all properly managed. Treasure being lost..

title: nice architecture
review: we just saw this from outside.amidst some busy crowded raod stands this haveli.it has a old traditional look

title: Average
review: Just get a picture clicked from outside. Internal tour is not recommended. Better go for Patwaon ki Haveli, which is a must visit.

title: Ornate piece of architecture but badly maintained
review: This haveli, built in the eighteenth century, is touted as a major tourist attraction. Salim Singh, the then ruler of Jaisalmer, commissioned the construction of this haveli.

title: Nice art work on haveli
review: This is a must see while on a city tour of Jaisalmer. Beautiful and intricate sculptures and work of art in haveli !

title: Small and nice Haveli.
review: This is one of the smaller haveli's and a part of it is still occupied. The guide that took us around described the history well and explained things in detail.We were also taken to a room where things were being sold but were not pressurised to buy anything.

title: over hyped, high priced, hostile residents
review: over hyped because most other buildings in the vicinity bear similar architecture. inhabitants are rather hostile towards Indian tourists who cannot be fooled with their fairy-tales, into paying hefty sums. Seems the badness of the original ancestor runs into the family even today. quite unlike the warm and helpful people of Jaisalmer, this family was very unfriendly.

title: Exit through the gift shop
review: You do not need ot go inside there is nothing worth seeing other than typical tourist stall and poorly maintained interiors.

title: Nice from the outside
review: A nice old Haveli with some brilliant external decoration

title: Average
review: Once you reach Jaisalmer you'll see endless haveli's. Every hotel, house etc is built using same stone and designed in similar way.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: I thought it was gorgeous. A little over priced but well Maintained and lots of beautiful light filtered through the building for the photo lovers like me. Don't bother with the gift shop and stroll the streets after for the same stuff but fraction of the price. If you choose to go to a Haveli id definitely go to this one and skip the rest. Once you've seen one, you've seen them all and this one was lovely.

title: very good house
review: Salam singh ki haveli was the house of a then prime minister. Like any other big havelis, this one also has got intrinsic works on the walls, windows, balconies etc. In fact this haveli is still owned by the successors of salam singh and they are residing in a section of this haveli. I got a man from his 7th generation as the guide and his informations were valuable for understanding the past life of the people. I highly recommend you to hire him only as the guide. Many data that he gave me was not available in the net also

title: Ridiculously Royal
review: By far our favourite place in Jaisalmer, we spent a good 3 hours here understanding, asking and absorbing the intellect of Salim Singh and his architects'. Do take a guide and ask him to tell you the story behind this haveli. Everything from the sitting rooms to the terraces to the stone crafting to even the stair cases have a reason for being the way they are. Ah! Wish I was a princess there. Truly a royal experience.

title: Nothing here to see
review: Ticket seller here is rude. There is nothing to see inside, there is probably more in the average house in Jaisalmer to see. Just stick to Patwon ki Haveli that is the only one worth seeing.

title: dilaplated condition
review: outside view is good but the condition from inside is too poor and needs extensive repair and renovation

title: Good to visit
review: Just walking distance from Jaisalmer fort, By paying nominal amount visit from Inside and get personalized information and personal interaction with local residents.

title: Little Wonderful Haveli
review: During our day long visit in Jaisalmer old city, we visited this beautiful Haveli. It was so quite during our viist.

title: Beautiful Haveli ill kept
review: This Haveli is a beautifully built haveli as they are in Jaisalmer. However It is still under private control and looks as if in rundown state as compared to other havelis.A part of the most photographed top Portion has already been damaged.

title: Incredible House!
review: The level of detail of this house is just amazing! and the owners are very nice and encourage to visit all the corners proudly explaining all the story behind the house and their ancestors

title: Historical place
review: This hawali is historical and the salam singh haweli have different stories like adult story and some people say other stories like all rumors.

title: Good
review: So so what's good view but some another Haveli good this one so so life is always happy anywhere take care

title: extravagantly carved mansion
review: The palatial house was built for Salim Singh, prime minister of Jaisalmer, over 300 years back. The exquisitely carved arch roof is in the shape of a peacock. People still live here.

title: See from outside
review: Salim Singh was a villain. If you have a guided tour, you will know all about him. The whole colony outside jaisalmer fort is beautiful and keep walking to find this structure. Come here if you have extra time.

title: Nice Haveli of Salim Singh
review: This architectural piece is located in the heart of Jaisalmer,close to the Railway Station.This haveli has various tuskers that guard the gateway.This haveli is also called as Jahazmahal,as the front facet resembles a ship stem.Its roof is in the shape of a peacock and its location beside the hills adds to the beauty of the Haveli.

title: Waste of money and time!
review: This is nothing against patwaonki haveli. The person inside (guide?) is rude and charged me extra 50 for doing a video even though I had camera ticket. Don't waste your time here.

title: Boat by the Railway Station!
review: The ornate stonework of the balconies and roof are the standout features of this stunning building which is reputed to be in the shape of a boat although that was not evident to me

title: Its a fascinating piece of old architecture.
review: The guide is a great story teller..it was fun hearing all the stories about the Prime Minister and Royalty.

title: Learn about a haveli
review: We were looking for one of the better known historic Haveli but came across this one, so we went inside and were shown around by a very informative guide who spent a long time describing the structure and function of the building which was really interesting. Being India, there was of course the opportunity to spend your tourist rupees on all sorts of items but there was no pressure or hard sell like at most other places, and we got a better insight into the life of people who had lived there than at other sites.

title: for the
review: Its not the most decorated from the havelis but its the best for those who want to learn something about it and about the life in the dessert town. The guide is a great story teller..he tells you not only the stories about the life of the nobility but also a lot about the construction of the building. We really enjoyed the tour.

title: Heart of the Bazaar
review: Jaisalmer has a lot of havelis with roughly the same architectural style. Patwaon ki haveli is arguably the best but Salim Singh ki Haveli is definitely most conveniently located, right in the main Gandhi bazaar. 5 mins walk away is the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Architecture marvel
review: In the mid town a beautiful architecture marvel exists. It's private and is man tainted by the family. Worth visiting.

title: Salim Singh-ki Haveli
review: Salim Singh-ki Haveli is one of sightseeing place situated in the heart of jaisalmer. now converted in hotel and restaurant.

title: Worst haveli
review: Its one of the smallest and worst haveli I have visited. Its actually a old 3 story haveli type home with an entry fee of rs 30. Nothing especial to waste time visiting this.

title: Beautiful place
review: This haveli is a very beautiful place in the middle of Jaisalmer. Worth visiting haveli of this area. Take the guide and spent a long time describing the structure and function of the building which was really interesting.

title: Not worth a visit
review: Unlike Patwon-Ki-Haveli, this one is in  very dilapidated condition with hardly any maintenance. Except the hanging balcony with it's intrinsic work, which  you can see from outside there is hardly anything to see.

title: Amazing havelli
review: We passed by this havelli while walking from Jaisalmer fort towards the Gadisar lake. We decided to go inside for a visit and we had an excellent guide explaining the different architectural aspects of this havelli. The highlight of this havelli is the stone made lotuses which could be fitted in the walls like light bulbs !!!

title: same haveli
review: if you see patwon ki haveli thats enough. a haveli is a haveli.take some photos thats it.we didn't find it interesting though

title: Historic and mesmerizing
review: The Haveli depicts the lavish lifestyle of the Salim Singh who was one of the most powerful person in the Clan.

title: total time waste
review: you are not allow to enter inside haveli.. no museum nothing to attract apart from stone architect that too can see from outside

title: Just another Haveli
review: Note that tourists are not allowed to enter this Haveli. You can see it from outside, but its not worth the effort unless you are an architecture/history enthusiast.

title: Heritage
review: Very good place to visit. Should go there and complete visit with the fort itself. Very close to the fort.

title: best to see
review: every thing was good no words to describe, just go and visit jaisalmer, don't forget to take camera with you.

title: For the ones who are interested in the old day construction
review: The person who lives in this beautifu haveli has a lot of very interesting stories to tell, on customs, manners and architectural historical construction; he has an interesting shop with lots of curiosities with an appropriate explanation without pushing to sell. Thanks again!

title: Fantastic stone carving work
review: A must visit place in jaisalmer for stone art lover, jaisalmer is beautiful city it self,and this place is one of the most beautiful place.

title: A great piece of architecture....!!!
review: This structure is really a good example of art and architecture and engineering. Every space and element is designed by keeping the security in mind even though it doesn’t lack in terms of aesthetics. It is sound in both the terms. It would be better if you get the chance to listen the HAVELI’s  story from their present owner. The structure can be identified from anywhere in the city due to its cantilevered floors and it actually seems like floating floor.

title: Very nice
review: A very interesting tour guided by an interesting and knowledgeable gentleman. Very cheap morning sightseeing and good insight to local life.

title: Informative and interesting
review: As I haven't visited any other haveli's in the area I found the tour provided by Rajit to be interesting and informative, and I throughly enjoyed it. He pointed out a lot of the intricate details in the stone work and even showed some of the oil lamps and burners that would have been used at the time. The haveli isn't in great condition but it was a great tour nonetheless.

title: Salim singh
review: great architecture but you are not allowed to go inside hence i found it a waste of time and walk to the place.

title: Nothing much
review: Nothing much to see as the place is not open to the public. You could probably have a glimpse while driving down the alleys.

title: Near Jaisalmer Fort
review: Actually, the correct name is Salam Singh Ki Haveli. It is also called Moti Mahal. It is at a walking distance from the main gate of Jaisalmer Fort. It remains open from 8 am to 6 pm.

title: Do not visit the place
review: I request all the travelers for jaisalmer  to not to visit the place. It's waste of time if you visit the place. It's just waste of time to visit the place. Better you visit Patwon ki Haveli which is way better than this place

title: Walk by the haveli is more than enough
review: Its just a haveli with same intricate carvings that you see across Rajasthan. Nothing different. The guide who took you through Jaisalmer Fort will give you the story behind Salim Singh and the haveli and that should be it. No need to waste lots of energies in debating over this.

title: Another amazing Haveli
review: There are only three or four of the major Havelis that you must visit in Jaisalmer.  This is one of them.  You don't have to go in but you do need to go and see it.  The architecture and lattice work carving into the stone is beautiful. You can walk to this and two more havelis from the fort on the way to the lake and get them all covered in the one trip. Thank heavens the government is preserving these lovely old town houses.

title: Intricate  art work on sand stone, a rajasthan style.
review: We traveled the place with a group.  We have seen similar craftsmanship in other  places of Rajasthan. It is sill  standing tall in our cultural history.  But I am not sure about its future.

title: The beautiful rajasthan
review: The haveli is beautiful with lots if intricate design outside. A part of beautiful golden city of jaisalmer

title: Scraping the bottom of the barrel
review: We are really scraping the bottom of the barrel here. When I went, almost all the doors were locked on the way up the main staircase. It gets one star because the view on the roof is nice. Otherwise completely pointless, there is really nothing to see here.

title: Museum with Archtiecture
review: The haveli has fine architecture. There are 5 consecutive haveli's of which only one is open tourist. The haveli is now more of a museum and the first floor is a shop for Jaisalmer goods. The guide one will hire there will most probably be a worker in the shop who will take you around and lastly to the shop. Not much explanation required from the Guide if one take tour of Nathal ji ki Haveli first with a guide. The rest of the museum is self-explainatory with boards in English.

title: Beautiful and intricate
review: such a beautiful example of architecture. I hope Rajashthan govt pay more attention to cleanliness and maintenance of these magnificent buildings.

title: Beautiful piece of architecture
review: Occupied by the most influential family in XVIII century Jaisalmer. The roof of the haveli has been constructed in the form of Peacock. The haveli consists of as many as 38 balconies and they all have distinct designs for themselves. Open early morning till 5 P.M.

title: A GOOD PIECE OF ARCHITECTURE
review: Visited the haveli on 01.01.2016. though the haveli is situated in very interior of the city, so one has to be expert in driving in narrow lanes leading to haveli. the haveli is equally good as patwon ki haveli. The district administration must pay attention towards the cleanliness of the area surrounding the haveli.

title: average as all haveli's are more or less same
review: not so much impressed as all other haveli's near by look the same. This one has some old vessels, musical instruments also some astrological instruments kept which made it unusual.

title: Just bypass it !
review: Just viewed it while taking the city tour. Nothing very exceptional about it but a check list of city tour.

title: Heritage of Jaisalmer
review: The fact that every single tiny detail of this Haveli had about 5 reasons for it to be there. Intricate carvings and stone and mirror works are the cursory observations and things to wonder about - the real intricacy is explained when the 9th generation descendant of Salim Singh ji would explain you why the things are as they are. Perfect Architectural visit. Splendid example of Architecture!!!

title: Good architecture
review: Good show case of old time architecture, well thought and beautifully constructed. Taking a guide is a must so you understand   how and why it's built. There was so much detail to it.

title: There is nothing much inside , badly maintained as well - just see it from outside.
review: The haveli is badly maintained, there is nothing much to see inside as well.The haveli is privately owned. You can skip going inside if you are short on time or even otherwise. The haveli looks nice only from outside. You are not gonna miss anything by not going inside.

title: Fascinating insight into 16th century Jaisalmer.
review: We decided to spend time properly absorbing one of the 3 famous haveli rather than dashing around all 3. Gajju did an excellent job sharing his passion and deep knowledge of the history of the haveli, he has worked there for 15 years and is skilled in imparting details of its origins and past. We especially were fascinated by the working details about f the security of the house and also the relationship between the Prime Minister and the Zenana. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

title: Very Nice Place
review: Must visit place. Use Guide.

title: Nice Haveli
review: Old and nice haveli. These havelis are famous for its cravings on the red stone. The roads to these havelis are very narrow and you car will not reach there. You have to hire a auto from the stand to reach these places. The auto driver will be your guide.

title: Amazingly large house with exquisite carvings
review: This house is HUGE !!! and I mean HUGE !!!

title: Good building
review: Is a good building.....  Located in main city of Jaisalmer....  Made by yellow stones...  Vary good design..

title: Just another haveli
review: Generally all havelis are beautiful but care need s to be taken for maintenance. This is also a private Haveli. There are camera and ticket charges.  One can take a otto to visit as lanes are too narrow. Nice architecture,

title: Architecture Delight
review: Until and unless you go inside and take the service of the guide you will never know what you are missing.

title: A thumbs down for this
review: I dont know how the owners of this can be so rude and that too after charging a hefty entrance fee. The so called guides are equally rude and are probably owners agent.

title: Interesting
review: Well maintained and beautifully intricate craftsmanship. Interesting history behind the haveli revealed by guide.

title: It has seen much better days...
review: People still live inside this haveli so clearly this has its drawbacks. Not sure how long this will continue as clearly it will have one winner in the end either haveli or the people. Architecture is beautiful and if you are a real history buff go for it or else there are many more places to go.

title: Average
review: It is average. View is awesome from the top. From outside it is o beautiful. I have clicked so many photographs.

title: get a view from sonar kila
review: you get a very good view of this haveli from the golder fort of jaisalmer. it is exactly in front of you at some distance. towards your left are patwa haveli and nathmalji ki haveli. all these havelis can be visited by walking for 10 minutes. No need of taking a car on narrow roads. just get down from the fort and take the left road leading to these havelis...

title: Do not waste your time
review: There is an entry fee, but there is nothing to see as family is staying inside. Also the place is not very clean, only one wing of the haveli is open.

title: Take time out to visit
review: Most guides will not take you inside. For a nominal fee, the current residents who are the descendants, will show you around and regale you with stories from the past. You get see the architecture and it marvels from close quarters - all explained to you in detail by the 7th generation resident

title: poorly maintained, not worth visiting
review: Not worth visiting, poorly maintained property, nothing great about it . Do not waste time travelling to this place.

title: Better from the outside.
review: Waste of rs30 to go inside. Climb 5 dark empty abandoned floor to see it from the outside still. Place is falling apart and just being concreted back together. Beautiful building but a shame it has not been preseverd better.

title: A haveli with 38 balconies
review: This haveli is famous for its balcony design. Its contains near about 38 balconies with different and distinct designs.

title: Waste of time and money
review: This is one of the 3 famous havelis of Jaisalmer, but there is not much to see here. And to top it off there was an entry and camera ticket, and they were offering a guide to the place too. Not sure what is being done with the ticket, the haveli is very small but was not at all clean and not at all maintained. It's better to skip this haveli.

title: Unique architecture
review: The Salam Sing Ki Haveli is a short walk from the entrance of the Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Another Haveli
review: One of many havelis in Jaisalmer. Impressive to look at and good to photograph. not worth going to visit specially

title: worst spent 30rs!!
review: The building is badly maintained and the views from the top are nothing spectacular. Save your money and time and visit the Patwa ki Haveli instead!

title: Time well spent
review: The guide did a great job explaining and demonstrating  the sandstone construction that used no mortar. It was amazing - he also showed us a variety of different brass objects and their uses-  with of course,  a sales pitch to buy the replicas. Overall I enjoyed the visit and got a better appreciation for the work involved in creating these impressive havelis!

title: Nothing Special
review: The havelis are of grand stone work and design but if you have seen Haveli of Patwas or of Nathu,this stands no where.Only near to fort and story made by guides and local people that Dewan of king was building his Haveli up to the label of fort and King destroyed it by a canon.This canon is situated at fort and guides say it was used only once to destroy this Haveli.All story seems fabricated as no part of this Haveli is damaged,rather upper portions are beautifully carved with arches.The local incharge will charge Rs.30 per person and your knees and legs should be strong to go upp stairs and three floors.You can skip this monument if seen other big Havelis.

title: Another Haveli
review: Nothing good as compare to patwa's but if you had time and want to see something, can visit this place.

title: Interesting
review: Heritage Property with good construction techniques. The successors do take interest in explaining to guests about the haveli.

title: Nice piece of Rajasthani Architecture..
review: It is one of the sight seeing places everyone recommend you when you go to jaisalmer.

title: Shabby and not maintained
review: The experience was terrible and did not like the haveli at all. The person taking visitors for showing the insides of haveli is extremely rude and unprofessional. Utter waste of time and money spent on entry ticket and Camera ticket. Nothing when compared to other monuments

title: An amazing, original form
review: This XVIII century haveli has an amazing, original form. The first floor is very narrow but extends upward. The upper floor is replete with carvings and the graceful arched balconies are topped with blue domes.

title: Historical and architectural qualities
review: Salamsingh Haveli is an interesting haveli but needs some conservation work. Our guide did an amazing job explaining the history of the buildings and its architecture and its significance for the region. The history makes it unique. It's mostly for architecture and history lovers, not as much travelers who are simply looking for a beautifully restored merchant's haveli.

title: Nice Haveli and story behind it.
review: Its a Haveli belonging to the minister of the king of Jaisalmer and infamous for the abandonment of kuldhara, Salem singh. What is the real story no one knows. But the architecture and the interlocking technique demonstrated here is awesome and ahead of its time.

title: Nice one...only if you have time to spare
review: This building has a long history which the guide will tell you if you have time. not much to see really. and needs better maintenance. some good architectures can be seen specially on the roof top. If you have a taste for fragrances....'ittar'....that is.....then DO try their collections.

title: A jewel of Medieval Indian architecture
review: I loved this place being an architect. It has one of the best examples of traditional north Indian style architecture, I have ever seen. Poor maintenance is a major concern. Yet this a place one should visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Distinct Architecture
review: Salim Singh ki haveli has been built on the remains of an older haveli.  I was also informed that the This haveli was commissioned by Salim Singh, the then Prime Minister of the kingdom when Jaisalmer was the capital. The haveli has a distinct architecture. The roof has been constructed in the form of Peacock

title: Terrible guide
review: Salim Singh ki haveli, please train your guides regarding how to interact with tourists. We were the guide's only visitors this morning. He was very surly and resented it when we tried to take photos during his explanation. I was immediately turned off. Skip this place. Not worth it because of the guide's poor attitude.

title: MEH!!!
review: The Salim Singh Havelli is beautiful on the outside and the inside like almost every other building in Jaisalmer. The only special things about it is how old it is and the Prime minister of Jaisalmer lived there. The guide Raju is a total tool. I'm a photographer and paid to bring in my camera and was told very roughly that my taking of pictures was disrupting his less than enthusiastic explanations. I give this place a....... MEH!!

title: Mirchi Seth ki Haveli
review: more popularly known as mirchi seth ki haveli as it was used on a shoot of a bollywood film,there is an entry fee.

title: Zalim singh ki haveli
review: By hearing the stories if salim singh one would say that it should be Zalim singh ki haveli, anyways very old structure, near to fort and an entry fee

title: Over hyped.!
review: If you visit Patwon Ki Haveli, then no need to visit Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli & Salim Haveli and hence can be skipped and time would be saved. Further general public is not allowed to go inside. You can just view the Haveli from outside.

title: Basly Maintained
review: The three Haveli in Jaisalmer is being used by the descendants.  It is badly maintained and this heritage will soon be lost if the Government does not act on this quickly. The place surrounding these Haveli are filthy and filthy. Since there are people staying there, one cannot get to see the inside, only a view from outside.

title: Really interesting haveli.
review: Very beautiful, very interesting old haveli, intricately carved in golden sandstone. The guide who showed us round was excellent.

title: Nathmal Haveli is better
review: Like Nathmal Haveli this Salim Singh Haveli is slightly unmaintained. Salim Singh was a Minister under the King. The king used to rely on him very much but Salim Singh wanted to topple him and become the king. So his Haveli was bombarded from the Fort when King came to know about his plans. This is what people there tell.

title: not to be missed
review: Only place I found the guide giving us a detailed account of what happened in the old days .it made for a very interesting tour .

title: Nice Haveli
review: Next to Patwaon-ki-haveli, a must visit place when you are in Jaisalmer. Architectural design is fantastic and how minutely every art piece had made many years back, when technology was not developed however, artwork was very matured.

title: Nothing to see at this place.
review: i reached at this place, took the visiting ticket that cost me around 40-50 bucks, and reception person pointed me that place i should visit to see beauty of this haveli. but the disappointing thing was that i didn't find anything to praise.

title: average haveli
review: There is nothing much in this haveli as compare to patwon ke haveli (private haveli).You need to check your heads as the doors are short .Chances of hitting your head against the door roof.

title: See it before it becomes a ruin
review: The architecture of this grand mansion resembles the posture of a dancing peacock.  There are over 35 balconies, all unique in design and carvings.  Ask the guide to point out the secret treasure hiding places of the minister.  Regrettably much of the structure is in disrepair.

title: Worst place of Jaisalmer.
review: This is Worst palace in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan, India. Nothing to see here. You can see so many havelleys like this, even hotels also. The behavior of the guides in this place are sooo disgusting. You can go there, if you want to take a toilet. Don't waste your time.

title: AVERAGE HAVELI
review: This Haveli of Salim Singh was built by him around the early 1800's. He was the notorious Prime Minister to the Maharwal of Jaisalmer. He is also known as the cause of the exodus of the Paliwal Brahmins from Kuldhara and other villages. The haveli roof has been constructed in the form of a peacock. There are two elephants made of Jaisalmer sandstone guarding the entrance to the haveli. The haveli has numerous balconies and wonderful filigree carvings. The front facade of the haveli is in the form of the stern of a ship and a great many locals also call the haveli as Jahaz Mahal. There is nothing within the haveli and it is better to see the haveli from the outside if time is at a premium and you dont want to spend the ticket money to see nothing inside. Overall an average visit.

title: Good only if you are interested in the ways of living of people of that era
review: An old small building, built without cement or any other glue and is foldable. Is good when you have interest in what all was done in that era and how people constructed there houses to be safe from intruders.

title: Salam Singh ki Haveli actually
review: The name is wrongly mentioned in most guide books and sites... it is Salam Singh's Haveli and not Salim Singh... the people who run it claimed they were his 7th generation and defy all other stories I had read about the place till date... the haveli though is worth a visit and their guide explained things quite well. Steep steps if you have an older person along you but the intricacies were quite captivating for me...

title: Another beautiful Haveli
review: This is another beautiful haveli after the patwanon ki haveli and should not be misses. Beautiful stone carvings on the doors and windows make it a visit well worth.

title: Worth Getting the Tour
review: We had a very nice visit. The Haveli is beautiful and well maintained. Its not huge, but it has a few very nice rooms and a beautiful view of from the top.

title: Beautiful haveli in crowded market
review: Its a beautiful haveli lost in a crowded market has intricate carvings and architecture and reminds us of a lost era when it must hve been used to see the processions by king's queens and their caretakers !!!!!!!

title: Beautiful mansion
review: Actual pronunciation is Saalim Singh ki haveli. It is a beautiful mansion of Saalim Singhji and having nice architecture of the old age.

title: Photo the exterior from a position across the street and move on
review: Using our guide book map, we easily walked here.

title: beware the sting
review: The low entrance price belies the fact that the top floors are in fact souvenir shops and you be subjected to to emotional pressure to buy the tat.  This is a shame because the haveli is interesting, as is the tour.  It's just a shame that awkward moments result when you are expected to buy the same stuff you have been avoiding for the rest of your trip.

title: Another Beautiful Architecture to Visit
review: This haveli was commissioned by Salim Singh, the then Prime Minister of the kingdom when Jaisalmer was the capital. The haveli has a distinct architecture and amazing curving and work on golden sandstone. The roof has been constructed in the form of Peacock.

title: Forget the drama - this is a unique building
review: I've read some other reviews and had my own weird experience with the guide here (who treated me well but not so some others, Indians who refused to pay and insulted him by saying there was nothing worth seeing here - untrue). That said, and speaking as an architect, this was one of my favorite buildings visited during a 4 week tour through Rajasthan. Not only is it a spatially unusual building but the current run-down state of it means you can actually see layers of construction - not an unusal condition for India but here I found it really legible. Also it's quirky - the top floor with it's central cradle, remnants of mirrored decorative ceilings and walls (in a room where I was told a dancer would perform!?), tiny balconies around (they're not likely to fall down any time soon imo - they're just not cantilevering very far at all).... just look at photos of the outside - you will not find another building like this in Rajasthan and it's intimate scale and the explaination of it's ergonomics (the lack of headroom and dangerous, varying proportions of the stairs for example helped stop intruders) made it, for me, a captivating experience. And by the way - if you are discouraged by a bit of drama, then don't go to India, let alone this extaordinary building.

title: Worth a look for the Rooftop View.
review: The exterior is worth a look but interior not so although the view to Jaisalmer Fort from top of Havelis is worth the entrance fee.

title: Best view of the fort
review: The haveli is nothing really spectacular, aside from the fact that it is unusual in appearance (slightly oversized top). It has beautiful carvings and it is located near Natraj restaurant, so it's a good spot to visit in the morning after having breakfast at Natraj. The haveli's best feature is that it has the best views of the fort, so that makes it a must-stop

title: Good experience
review: There must be several guides. The guide who showed us around was courteous, knowledgeable and informative. He was able to inform us about the history of the family, the architecture and building of the haveli. The painted walls and mirror tiles were of particular interest to us, remnants of an opulent past. We passed through the shops, where our guide explained the goods and the reason for the sale - to help maintain the building. We did not feel unduly pressured to buy anything. A visit well worth the small entry fee and small (voluntary) gratuity for our guide.

title: Not worth it at all
review: I visited this place on April 25th with my partner and left it completely dissapointed.We had visited other havelis in Jaisalmer and other towns and they were great, but on this one there was literally nothing interesting to see. The city views were nothing spectacular either.

title: Hmm.
review: Another impressive haveli outside but nothing you won't see elsewhere. Inside, don't bother. Maybe the tour is interesting but without it there is nothing much to see but a couple of empty rooms. Even the fort view is distinctly average. Could do with some looking after too.

title: No Need to Visit
review: The entry fee is Rs. 50 (With Camera).

title: Nice Haveli...
review: A haveli that is situated in the heart of the city and has a bunch of stories associated with it. Indeed a place to visit

title: Nothing inside
review: Some lovely carving overhanging the streets, just as well viewed from the outside as from the inside. Little more of interest inside, you'd be better off eating at one of the nearby rooftop restaurants and viewing from there.

title: Terrible- Its a Cheat
review: Nothing is there. Its a trap for charging Money. We were charged 60 Rs. for two Persons and 20 Rs. for Camera total Rs.80 and wat we found were 3 set of stairs which lead us to Roof. Guys avoid this nothing is there.

title: Nothing much to see
review: This is one of the Hawelis which is not in good condition. One can see from outside and take photos beacuse there is nothing to see. The staircase is very dark and have to be careful climbing up. This has a terrace from where you have a good fort view and take some snaps. Not worth visit if short on time but if you have time just quickly scroll through. The entrance fee and camera fee is charged as well.

title: This one can be avoided..its in ruins.
review: This is a badly kept place which can be avoided. The entrance fee is also high Rs. 30 which is not justified.....The place is in ruins....

title: Interesting
review: There are better Havelis, but this one is interesting,  very dilapidated in parts. Only 50 rupee, ang a guide is available should you want one.

title: NIL value
review: this appears to be more of a normal residence. I skipped paying internal visit to this place. Suggest to drop this from ur list if u r running short of time. Will not add to good memories

title: Can view from out side
review: Located within city and walking distance of the fort is this haveli. Intricately carved structure that can be seen from road side.

title: You should use a guide service here - and than you'll have a great experience
review: The haveli itself maybe smaller and not so impressive if you just stroll around, but if you'll be lucky enough to have a guide (one of the family who owns this haveli) - it'll stay one of the most memorable experience in Jaisalmer. The guide managed to breathe a life in those old stones - he was so passionate and exact about how the havely was build, how they lived there, he told so many interesting stories and showed us things we'd never noticed by ourself. I also like the way he explained everything to us - It seems he explained a plan of military compaign :) This visit was one of the highlights of our visit in Jaisalmer as it really gave us the idea how people lived in that desert city several hundreds years ago.

title: A must see
review: It was a memorable experience to visit this haveli, a guide is a must. one of the family members does the honours. it is really worth while to listen to him and see the haveli with him. it is as if the old times come alive. what looks like a small room suddenly has much more meaning and relevance. please make it a point to visit the haveli and take a guide. it has awesome architecture and excellent view point of the fort.

title: Salem Singh and not Salim
review: Nice work .. nice view of the fort.. you are forced to take a guide .. but the explanations are relevant.. Stick to Hindi..

title: Avoid going to this place. Nothing to see and risky too
review: The entry fee is 30rs per person but it has nothing to see inside. Simply waste of time. The balconies are handing and may fall anytime. I would suggest not to visit this place.

title: BATS!
review: Watch out for the bats in the darker portions of the haveli.. And don't miss out on the storage system used by the people who worked there in the kitchen.

title: A good haveli and even better shopping destination
review: A beautiful old building with intricate carvings, stunning sunrise view of the fort from the balcony and a spectacular dancing room. The man who takes care of the haveli personally offers a guided tour and explains the history and beauty of it with pride. The sunrise watch is highly recommended and so is the antique replicas shopping. Beautiful animal shaped lamps, opium pipes, carved boxes and aromatic oils are must buys. Well priced and properly packed, they make great gifts. Highly recommended

title: Bad behaviour
review: opening time 8am to 6pm, we went at 12.15pm, they did not allowed us to enter saying the person has gone for lunch will be back at 3pm, 3hrs for lunch, no backup, board says something. He unnecessary argues, understands nothing. Admin should check and take immediate action. We enjoyed from outside.

title: not worth visiting
review: poor management and poorly maintained.Open time : 8:00 am to 7:00 pm as mentioned on sign board.I reached there at 9:00 in the morning but the caretaker told me that haveli is not ready yet and to come back after couple of hours as it will take time to manage it in this lazy weather - wow - if its cloudy then they are lazy . But after some forced persuasion he let me in.

title: how to neglet what we have -come we will teach you
review: what a history and we damage it

title: Wastage of time & money
review: Not good behavior of the staff. Poorly maintained. Very small place. Only rooftop has fresh air. Nothing to see. Go & see other Havelies. Taken money for camera ticket, but not issued a ticket saying they are under print. Save money & time.

title: From the outside
review: We didn't go inside because apparently there's nothing much to see and we wanted to spend more time at Bada Bagh.

title: Must visit
review: We met the great grand son of Salem singh. He is so proud of his ancestors and gave us personal attention and told each and every detail of this place

title: very poorly maintained
review: this is the haveli with very fine work but very poorly maintained.gate of haveli is full of gargage & dirty water.

title: Visit if you have nothing else to do
review: Been there on 17th Nov.

title: Go only if you have time and not bored of seeing havelis in Jaisalmer
review: One you have seen other havelis like jaisalmer fort, patwaon ki haveli this one will not be of any interest to you.

title: Fun to search for the differences
review: If you have a sibling, this is fun to look at: two brothers had their havelis next to each other, and while they look identical, of course they are not.

title: marvelous architechture.
review: Steps are high otherwise it is an architectural marvel. How the stones are joined in almost all old havelis of Jaisalmer could be seen there. The new generation architect must learn the technique

title: In poor shape
review: The haveli is in very poor shape. Not worth the visit inside honestly. Whatever's there to be seen can be seen from the outside - primarily the top part of the structure.

title: Not just avoidable, must avoid
review: This is just not worth a visit. As you climb through narrow and high stairs to the top of this Haveli, you just wonder as to why you at all came to visit this place paying an entry fee (and a separate fee for your camera). The only thing nice here is a nicely decorated top floor, which is better seen from outside - you can also see it from the fort. If you climb all the way to the terrace, you still don't see this any better (from outside it is still much better)  from what you saw from outside.

title: beautiful
review: Looked at it from a distance ... good .. amazing carvings and very beautiful , must visit...        and also hear more about the legend of Diwan Salim Singh

title: Only visit if you have loads of time
review: This is just a run down, old haveli (mansion house) with very little to show for itself apart from the very top floor which is very ornate but not in good condition. They charge for a camera, and you have to be escorted around by a guard which is probably a good idea given the state of the place. This is a very poor cousin of the exquisitely beautiful Patwa-ki-haveli, both in terms of condition and the architecture, carvings etc. If you are looking to choose one haveli, just go to Patwa's and skip this one. As other people have pointed out, the top floor of this haveli is actually better viewed externally, so save yourself the hassle of going here.

title: Poor Maintained , hard sale of souvenir.
review: I felt uncomfortable during visit Salim Singh-ki Haveli. The entrance fee is quite cheap but it is poor management.The haveli itself , also the history are interesting but the official guide of this haveli tried to do hard sale of souvenir almost the time during my visit.He said the cheap entrance fee cannot cover the maintenance cost of this haveli !!!!

title: Terrible
review: nothing at all to see in it... They charge rs20 for what I just dint get it...waste of a time... Non recommended

title: The guide made it into a great experience
review: We were guided throu this beatiful haveli by a man, who seemed to know a lot about the life here in the past centruries, and explained us a lot. He was very interested in the topic and could provide a good insight. It is possible to go to the very top floor, which feels like being in a luxury boat above the city and desert. There is a small shop near the top which helps to fund preservation of the haveli.

title: Nothing special at all
review: Don't bother going here. It's a poorly kept and cursed palace that requires an admission ticket. While the cost to get in is only Rs 25, I'd rather just buy myself a pop and stroll on the streets.

title: best seen from outside
review: Interesting architecture but not the best haveli in Jaisalmer.  The decoration is interesting, but its not as impressive as the Patwa havelli just a ten minute walk away.

title: Forts and Havelis trip of Jaisalmer, arranged by Ganesham Tours & Travels India Pvt. Ltd.
review: In the heart of Jaisalmer, Salim Ji Ki Haveli's roof has been constructed in the form of Peacock. it's like  a Ship. nice to see this amazing haveli special Thanks for the travel comapny Ganesham Tours and Travels India Pvt. Ltd. to make this for us.

title: Not impressive. No need to visit this.
review: There are better havelies all over the place in Jaisalmer than this one.

title: Another gem in Jaisalmer
review: I really don't understand comments like "don't waste your time here", "noting special", "if you seen one haveli there is no need to see another"?????? I mean if you are in Jaisalmer - city of havelis than you should visit and see all the havelis if you can... what waste of time??? no one spends here weeks... most tourist come here for only few days so there is no waste of time - see as much as you can...every haveli is story for itself... there are no two same... i'm really amazed when I see bad comments like I mentioned - esp coming from Indian people...this is your heritage and history...you should be proud!

title: Average from the outside
review: We went by the haveli, but it is no comparison to the Patwaon one. Plus eventhough you can pay to go inside our guide warned us that everything has been destroyed in an earth quake and not worth the visit. Double check if you really want to go in!

title: So So
review: As with other havelis, there's always some interesting information, and a beautiful building. But it was pretty unrestored (which has its own interest) and we were too closely followed by the custodian, so it became an uncomfortable experience.

title: nathmal ji ki haveli
review: the haveli of nathmal ji is very nice from outside but the owner who are his decendents are very rude and arrogant. the shop on the 1st floor sells antiques and new items.  i told i want to visit the shop they told me that only foreigners are allowed to go up. when i told why they told me the items are very expensive and only foreigners can afford to buy them. are indians so poor that they cant buy them? after insisting a lot they allowed me but was followed like i was going to steal some stuff. i bought a statue for rs 1500 and 3 -4 foreigners along with me bought nothing. another  person who was showing the goods to the foreigners was begging  to buy those goods  and said that we want to repair this haveli and we have to pay alot of taxes so we are selling goods here. and the owner was telling my dad that this is our personal property and it is up to us whom to allow or not. even if manmohan singh we will not allow him and government has forcibly declared this as a monument.

title: Worth A Visit
review: The haveli is in a state of disrepair but is cheap to enter,the brief tour was interesting and the view of the fort from the rooftop is good. It does not compare with many of the painted havelis in Shekhawati but is worth seeing if you have the time.

title: Not Necessary
review: The house is only marginally suitable for touring.  The guide/owner is a stern man with no people skills.  The place is falling down around their ears.  You are stopped in the souvenirs room and encouraged to purchase.  There has been zero effort to make this beautiful old haveli worth a visit.  We enjoyed the view from the top, we picked up a few tidbits and would never recommend it to anyone unless they understood what they were getting into.

title: Fascinating.
review: We were lucky enough to be shown around by one of the owners, an old man from the family who own it. He showed us around the building and gave explanations about what life was like living there in its heyday. He showed us the cunning way the decorative stonework was put together so that bits that deteriorated could be removed and replaced without having to do the whole facade, and explained a lot about the perilous living they endured in a part of the world where raids and robberies were common! There were defence strategies built into the house that we would never have understood or even noted, had they not been shown and explained to us. It was a fascinating glimpse into a rather deadly and uncertain life that the traders and their families lived. We really appreciated the time this man took to take us around, but it was pure luck that he was available and willing to do so when we were there. Hope you also get this treat if you go there! In any case, the building is well worth seeing.

title: see as many Haveli's as you can
review: ...not sure of all their names but these are another reason you would visit Jaisalmer. They are all stunning - some you can go inside - some not but they are all great to stand outside and maarvel at

title: Pretty Haveli.
review: A nice little Haveli with beautiful carvings on the outside which were well visible from the roof top restaurant adjacent to it. Sad that we could not see it from the inside as it was closed for viewing.

title: Terrible
review: There is nothing to see in this haveli. Its just a waste of time.Avoid this. To enter into this they will charge you, that is also a money waste.

title: Great museum
review: Full of artifacts and interesting information about the life in the havelis.  Ignore the rude and pushy 'guides' outside its nice to wander around alone you dont need a guide and the view from the roof is amazing

title: Nice
review: Fairly nice visit. Good overview of the local architecture. Museum shop = tourist trap, though... but then they don't ask for an entrance fee...

title: well worth the R20
review: Beautiful old haveli was guides round by a very knowledgeable man who explained the construction of the haveli and the history of it

title: Poorly kept haveli though splendid balcony
review: The balcony of this mansion juts up into the sky and must have been an impressive place at one time. Now the building is falling apart and no attempt to restore it seems visible. Families live inside most of it, other parts seem to be given over to handicraft sellers. So all you can really do is go to the terrace, and then they show you some of the faded rooms. The people there were pleasant though the whole experience was depressing.

title: Haveli looks more like a ruin + unfriendly people
review: Don't bother visiting this Haveli.  It is really dilapidated and needs structural maintenance works.  On top of that, the owners/staff are very unfriendly and seemed not happy at all that we wanted to visit their haveli.

title: Well worth it!
review: The very cheap guided tour was really interesting, with some great insights into the history of the house and town. There are interesting items to buy but no pressure.

title: Not what you expect
review: We went in- only 100R. Right after we visited the Patwa ki Haveli....  The guide gave us a GREAT tour - very informative and interesting and authentic.. We recommend going inside - it's much more then you expect...

title: Nothing compared to Patwon ki haveli
review: The only attractive feature of this haveli is on the upper floor,worth a couple of photographs.No guides to explain!All one knows is that it was this Salim Singh,the Dewan of Jaisalmer who exploited women and was responsible for the entire Kuldhara Village to become deserted overnight(as he had asked for a girl from that village).

title: no show
review: Don't buy a ticket to visit the haveli as there is ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to see.Just look at it from outside....Take my word n don't be fooled by the visitor's book as shown by the owners, like we were

title: Pretty and instructive
review: Good place to learn about architecture of havelis. Some pressure to buy souvenirs, though. They practically lure you to the "shopping room" where everything costs more than 400 rupees...

title: view only from outside.
review: view the haveli from outside. there is nothing to see inside.

title: A Heritage Haveli
review: Take a look at this heritage property and appreciate the fine stone work.

title: Very nice 300 yr. old Haveli to visit, 3 min walk from Jaisalmer Fort
review: We visited this Haveli, after reading nice write up in Lonely Planet last November.  Our 30 minute visit was pretty good.  The entrance was very cheap, don't recall the Rs price, but we didn't even bother to write it down.

title: May have fallen down by the time you read this!
review: Intriguing building brought alive by the resident guide. Cheap to enter and no hard sell once inside.

title: just alright
review: this place is pretty small, and not worth more than 30min of the time. i overheard some guide explaining the haveli, which doesn't help to make it more interesting. but of course, the view of the fort from the roof is great for pictures.

title: Just the best guide at this Haveli
review: I have to say the guide at the Salim Singh-ki Haveli was just the best,. He gave a presentation  – particularly the management of the environment in the context of history as well as the future. This haveli (which does not have the ornate interiors such as the nearby Patwa-ki_Haveli) is a authentic glimpse into people's lives 200 years ago.

title: Good to be seen from outside!
review: Not interesting, I couldn't find anything good with this one.

title: Visit a haveli in India...
review: Can´t leave india without visiting a haveli, these one gives a pretty good idea of how was daily live in Rajastán last century for wealthy people.

title: Elegant Side of A Tyrant
review: Salam Singh Haveli shows off vulnerable side of a tyrant minister - who caused Jaisalmer kingdom to become British protectorate in 1818. The tower housing rang mahal (house of colours) is rich in interior and exterior. Elaborate carvings of peacocks, flowers and floral patterns on the outside and play of light and colours in the inside paint a altogether a different side of Salam Singh.

title: awful
review: this place was a big disappointment.the place is poorly kept and the stink is quite overwhelming.there is hardly anything to see except for he balcony from whre you can see  the fort.very disappointing indeed

title: Lack of maintenance
review: Poorly maintained and grossly overcharged for the cameras. There are also no guides who could tell you something about the person or the place, its richness, its unique architecture or speciality of the place that make it one of the three most beautiful havelis in Jaisalmer

title: Only outside view
review: These haveli's you can see from outside. Very intricate carvings.

title: Another haveli
review: After a few days in rajasthan you get a bit bored with havelis and this one was very much an average one. the only really special one I saw was the one in Fatehpur lovingly restored by a French lady to most of its former glory.  This jaisalmer one is OK, but did not bowl me over: the best thing is probably the rooftop view of the town

title: Enjoyed and learned
review: Guided by Gaju.

title: Oldest Haveli outside Jaislamer Fort
review: Guide claims this to be oldest Haveli constructed outside Jaisalmer Fort. It is not maintained properly. Outside view of this monument is better than inside visit.

title: Beautiful exteriors
review: Within walking distance from the fort, this haveli has an exquisite structure. However, the insides are not too well maintained, so not worth to go inside. The more maintained Patwon ki Haveli is a better bet to take a full tour. Overall Salim Singh ki haveli is beautiful to look at from the outside, but the tour can be given a miss.

title: Beautiful old haveli
review: If you like art and details one can visit this beautiful old haveli. Not always a part of a standard tour package, one should check before booking

title: marvelous piece of art
review: I am amazed by breathtaking amount of handwork and detailing thats gone into every nook and corner of the Haveli.

title: Waste of Money and Time
review: Visited this haveli on 04 feb and trust me only exterior are nice and remaining part is waste of money.

title: Nothing to see
review: There is nothing special other than relation to the Kuldhara village. It's better to have a look from outside.

title: Interesting but run-down
review: I think that run-down is the most frequent word that I use in case of places of interests in south east asia. This Haveli is quite interesting already from the outside.One would expect that inside it looks at least as unique as form outside. Unfortunately, like in case of many monuments in that region inside part is very run-down. There was even a part of the roof that collapsed so one

title: One of the havelli
review: Nothing much to see from inside , its one of the havelli's at jaiselmer , its only good to see from outside otherwise run down and not preserved

title: Enjoyed and learned
review: Guided by Gaju.

title: Oldest Haveli outside Jaislamer Fort
review: Guide claims this to be oldest Haveli constructed outside Jaisalmer Fort. It is not maintained properly. Outside view of this monument is better than inside visit.

title: Waste of Money and Time
review: Visited this haveli on 04 feb and trust me only exterior are nice and remaining part is waste of money.

title: Beautiful old haveli
review: If you like art and details one can visit this beautiful old haveli. Not always a part of a standard tour package, one should check before booking

title: Nothing to see
review: There is nothing special other than relation to the Kuldhara village. It's better to have a look from outside.

title: marvelous piece of art
review: I am amazed by breathtaking amount of handwork and detailing thats gone into every nook and corner of the Haveli.

title: Interesting but run-down
review: I think that run-down is the most frequent word that I use in case of places of interests in south east asia. This Haveli is quite interesting already from the outside.One would expect that inside it looks at least as unique as form outside. Unfortunately, like in case of many monuments in that region inside part is very run-down. There was even a part of the roof that collapsed so one

title: Enjoyed and learned
review: Guided by Gaju.

title: One of the havelli
review: Nothing much to see from inside , its one of the havelli's at jaiselmer , its only good to see from outside otherwise run down and not preserved

title: Beautiful exteriors
review: Within walking distance from the fort, this haveli has an exquisite structure. However, the insides are not too well maintained, so not worth to go inside. The more maintained Patwon ki Haveli is a better bet to take a full tour. Overall Salim Singh ki haveli is beautiful to look at from the outside, but the tour can be given a miss.

title: Oldest Haveli outside Jaislamer Fort
review: Guide claims this to be oldest Haveli constructed outside Jaisalmer Fort. It is not maintained properly. Outside view of this monument is better than inside visit.

title: Beautiful old haveli
review: If you like art and details one can visit this beautiful old haveli. Not always a part of a standard tour package, one should check before booking

title: Beautiful exteriors
review: Within walking distance from the fort, this haveli has an exquisite structure. However, the insides are not too well maintained, so not worth to go inside. The more maintained Patwon ki Haveli is a better bet to take a full tour. Overall Salim Singh ki haveli is beautiful to look at from the outside, but the tour can be given a miss.

title: Waste of Money and Time
